Package View_controller

Class AddPartController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View_controller.AddPartController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddPartController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The AddPartController class implements the Initializable class and houses all the methods and fields needed to give the application interactivity on the AddPart application window.
    Author:
    JamesBundtrock

        public AddPartController​(Inventory inv)
        This is the constructor for this controller.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This override on the initialize method set this application window's fields to default values. However, in respect to the id field, it populates it with an auto-generated partId, since the user is not allowed to manually set this (as it must be unique).
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the locations is not known.
        rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
        See Also:
        Initializable.initialize(URL, ResourceBundle)

      • resetAllFields

        private void resetAllFields()
        This method sets all non-id TextField instances on the AddPart window to default values.

      • generatePartIDNumber

        private void generatePartIDNumber()
        This method auto-generates a new id for our prospective Part object. It sets the text of the id TextField and cannot be edited due to the TextField being disabled.

      • clearTextFieldOnClick

        private void clearTextFieldOnClick​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method clears a TextField when clicked on by a mouse.
        Parameters:
        event - The mouse click

      • selectInHousePart

        private void selectInHousePart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method allows the InHouse radio button to change the form to reflect the new Part being InHouse rather than Outsourced.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • selectOutsourcedPart

        private void selectOutsourcedPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method allows the Outsourced radio button to change the form to reflect the new Part being Outsourced rather than InHouse.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • cancelAddPart

        private void cancelAddPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This gives the cancel button on the AddPart window functionality, it returns the user to the MainScreen if ok is clicked on the confirmation window that pops up.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • errorAddPart

        private void errorAddPart​(int type,
                          javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This is the main error reporting method called when known exceptions or logic errors occur. If the error can be traced to a specific TextField, this method will border it in crimson.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of error
        field - the TextField where the error occurred, or null if no specific TextField can be determined to be the source of the error

      • fieldErrorTrigger

        private void fieldErrorTrigger​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This method colors a crimson border around any TextField passed to it. Always called by the errorAddPart, but sometimes passed null values when error cannot be determined to be within a TextField.
        Parameters:
        field - the TextField to border with crimson, or null if no border is to be changed

      • saveAddPart

        private void saveAddPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method gives the save button on the AddPart window functionality, as it checks the TextField values for logical and type errors. Any errors found call the errorAddPart method. This method also clears any crimson borders prior to calling the errorAddPart method, so that any new errors are easier to visually see to the user. If the TextField values pass validation and logic checks, the Part is added, and the user is put back to the MainScreen.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • resetFieldColors

        private void resetFieldColors()
        This method resets the borders to gray.

      • addInHousePart

        private void addInHousePart()
        This method pulls the values of the already validated TextField objects and parses their text values into their respective data types. Using these parsed values, it creates a new instance of an InHouse Part object and adds it to the Inventory instance, inv.

      • addOutsourcedPart

        private void addOutsourcedPart()
        This method pulls the values of the already validated TextField objects and parses their text values into their respective data types. Using these parsed values, it creates a new instance of an Outsourced Part object and adds it to the Inventory instance, inv.

      • mainScreenReturn

        private void mainScreenReturn​(javafx.event.Event event)
        Redirects the user to the MainScreen and changes the controller to the MainScreenController.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click on either the cancel or save buttons

      • valueCheck

        private boolean valueCheck​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This method checks each passed TextField for validity. The field must not be empty, and the price TextField cannot be less than zero. This also catches exceptions if invalid (such as letters) values are attempted to be parsed as a Double.
        Parameters:
        field - The TextField being checked
        Returns:
        The flag is False if no error found, or True if any error is found.

      • typeCheck

        private boolean typeCheck​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This method checks any TextField passed to it for being valid numbers for the data type. For the price field, it checks to see if it is a valid decimal number (or can be correctly parsed into one). For any other field passed to it, it checks to see if it is a valid whole number.
        Parameters:
        field - The TextField being checked
        Returns:
        Returns True if an error is found, False if no error is found
